recipes.name: MOMO
recipes.description: MOMO / Dumpling  is one of Nepal’s most popular dishes which can be eaten as a starter, snack,  lunch or dinner. It’s a dumpling filled with meat or vegetables  with homemade dough. MOMO is eaten with soybean,Tomato and sesame seed  mix Pickel. It is one of the must have food items in the Nepali restaurant all around the globe.
ingredients: 1/2 cup Green spring Onion Finely Chopped
3 tsp Mustard/ Vegetable Oil or Melted Butter

recipes.name: DHAL BHAT TARKARI
recipes.description: Dal-bhat-tarkari is eaten throughout Nepal. Dal is a soup made of lentils and spices. This is served over boiled grain, bhat—usually rice but sometimes another grain—with vegetable curry, tarkari and there is also an option for meat. Condiments are usually small amounts of extremely spicy chutney or pickle (achaar) which can be fresh or fermented. The variety of these is staggering, said to number in the thousands. Other accompaniments may be sliced lemon (nibuwa) or lime (kagati) with fresh green chili (hariyo khursani).
ingredients: 1/3 cup Green spring Onion Finely Chopped
Black peppercorns, mace, cinnamon, cloves, brown cardamom, tejpatta.
1/3 cup Green spring Onion Finely Chopped
1/3 Himalayan Herb Jimbo  dried leaves of a local
2 tsp Lapsi Powder - Nepalese Hog Plum
1/3 Healthy Foods: Health Benefits Of Asafoetida Or Hing

recipes.name: SEL ROTI
recipes.description: Sel roti is a traditional Nepalese cuisine which is special to our culture. These are made for festivals and many celebrations, but can also be made anytime.
